item.title: 12.6. B-Trees — CS3 Data Structures & Algorithms
item.description: The B-tree is shallow, in part because the tree is always height balanced (all leaf nodes are at the same level), and in part because the branching factor is quite high. So only a small number of disk blocks are accessed to reach a given record.
